explanation:
The correct calculation recognizes two adjacent angles forming a straight line: \( \text{green angle} + \text{pink angle} = 180^\circ \).  
The student incorrectly summed them as \( \text{green angle} + \text{pink angle} = 360^\circ \).  
The error stems from misapplying the total angle around a point (360°) to angles that are actually on a straight line.  
The student treated the two visible angles as comprising a full circle rather than a linear pair, confusing the angle sum rule for a straight line with that for a full rotation.  
This distinguishes from "ignores unlabelled angles" because no third angle is present, and from "incorrectly recalls total angle in a circle" because the error specifically conflates two distinct geometric configurations.
